column3: Watched this like 6 times end-to-end.

The EF team loves to send Lachian on lengthly solo self supported bike races that tests the limits of his mental and physical endurance. I would love to see EF send him to the (RAGBRAI) Register's Annual Great Bicycle Ride Across Iowa just so he can quietly lead by example and hang out with the locals.
Any one noticed at 1:47 mark this ""thing "" flying by? Yes and movie it's fantastic.
This is so inspirational. I want to be an endurance rider as well.
Awesome film! Really made it feel like we were riding with Lachlan the entire way.
star ‚≠êÔ∏è
Great vid. Really great. Just when you think you've seen all the obstacles Lachlan has faced 27:27 comes along, wtf !?üòÑ
Classy that you gave all the finishers their moment. Truly a magical video.
Rachel is a gem

Wow this is so goooooood, the music is great and the story telling as well. I would have loved to hear some of the other Riders as well. But how on earth was he able to keep his jersey so clean until the end?
wts that in the sky at 1:47 ?
Minuto 1.47 OVNI. buen documental. Deber√≠an der subtitulada Espa√±ol.

Way to go buddy!

What a top bloke Lachie is.... I had the pleasure of riding with him several times when he was a young fella back in Australia (and his dad and his brother). So nice to see he has turned out to be such a champion.

Some pro road teams have money and win races. EF might win fewer races, but they have something extra - passion - the rare kind of passion that inspires everyday cyclists across all disciplines and can't be bought. As someone who pledged funding for the EF crowdfunding appeal way back when, I'm overjoyed to see EF trailblazing in every sense. I enjoy my cycling more as a result of watching these films, they're very special.
Genuinely all you can do is laugh at this ffs incredible

I've done an Ultraman, 100 mile trail runs, 12 self-supported Ironmans, and all that crap, and I've watched tons of videos trying to capture the spirit of this stuff... This film is AMAZING.  One of the best ever.  And to see somebody as cool as L.M. (spitting image of Chris Cornell, btw) handling it with grace is the best part.  A must-watch for anybody wanting to do more than the status quo.
He is punching.
wowwwwww....!!!!! awesome Lachlan..
That dude with the speaker is an absolute boy to show up and show support like that
When is lachlan doing the divide?

Everyone forgets how much experience he has with rides like this. Watch all the rapha videos of him and his brother riding reeeeeeaaaaallly fast through the middle of nowhere over sand and rocks and you'll understand why he's the best human on a bike. He doesn't win tours but he rides further and faster than anyone alive. Lachlan is an absolute legend and there is no equal.
I‚Äôm the weirdo seeing UFOs in films now. 1:46 over his right shoulder?? What the F

column3: It seems that it must have been as much work doing the cinematography as it was for the bike riders.Bravo well done this was a remarkable journey to follow. I appreciate how much work went into putting just film together

Good Hollywood movie story line stuff. Sure, it's a pro that smashes non-pros in an endurance event, but obviously much more. Our hero accepts a challenge and has difficulties a long the way. He's uplifted by the beauty of the outdoors and the people he meets on his journey. He completes his mission while learning something greater about himself and the accomplishment.

It was a privilege to be part of this race on my Smokestone fatbike. Was incredible to meet Lachlan and ride with him for the first 90 mins or so before he took off up the road never to be seen again!!!Rapha and EF did a great job of capturing just how brutally hard this event truly was. kudosAll of the 30 other people who chucked their names in the hat to take part and mission down to lands end for the grand depart are heroes in my eyes, as are all involved from the racing collective in creating something so special.The bit the film didn't capture is Lachlan after he'd finished, he was dot watching away and personally messaging words of encouragement, a proper legend!!
